name: Brussels Sprouts and Kimchi from Roy Choi's 'L.A. Son'
description: Roy Choi's recipe for brussels sprouts and kimchi in his new cookbook/memoir, L.A. Son, is a prime example of his effortless expertise in Korean fusion. He throws sprouts, butter, kimchi, lemon, and shiso all together in a hot pan for a dish that looks like a miss-mashed stir-fry but tastes like a dish that's been made by countless cooks for generations.
recipeIngredient: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a pan over medium heat until it’s smoking. Add the oil and the brussels sprouts.
Move the pan around, caramelizing the sprouts, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the kimchi and toss.

Get some good color on everything, about 7 to 10 minutes, then add the butter. Swirl and season everything with salt, pepper, a squeeze of the lemon, and a sprinkle of the shiso leaves. Enjoy immediately.
